Context:
The text is about a Plumbing Techniques program offered at the college. The graduates of this program can bring entry-level plumbing skills to future employers and can work in various roles such as plumber, steamfitter, sprinkler systems installer, gas fitter, and sales and distribution. The construction industry is one of the largest employers in Canada, and skilled trades workers are among the highest paid and most in-demand in the country.

Semester 1 courses include Plumbing Trade Theory, Plumbing Trade Shop, Trade Documentation, Welding Trade Theory, Welding Trade Shop, Communicating Across Contexts, and an elective course. Semester 2 courses include Safety, Hoisting and Rigging, Plumbing Theory, Plumbing Practical Techniques, Plumbing Math, Blueprints and Graphic Communication, and a General Education Elective.

Program learning outcomes include working according to contractual obligations, performing residential plumbing projects effectively, working responsibly and effectively with others, using tools and equipment, contributing to the planning of projects, and solving routine problems related to work environments.

Domestic tuition for the program is $5,160.00, and international tuition is $17,837.00. Additional costs are mentioned but not specified in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Plumbing Techniques Program T165 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
International Tuition: $17,837.00 for fall 2022 and estimated $17,837.00 for spring 2024. (Fees are subject to change)
Financial Assistance: Approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet eligibility criteria.
Admission Requirements: Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English (C or U), and grade 11 math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U). Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English and math or upgrade to achieve credits in English and math. Meeting minimum requirements does not guarantee admission to the program, as applicants may be required to have higher grades.
Country-specific admission requirements: Visit the International Admissions page for more information.
Application Process: Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
School of Apprenticeship and Skilled Trades: Contact number 416 (For further queries regarding this school)
